result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Leavitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $250 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

defendant.name: Leavitt, Mark A.
defendant.address: N7989 State Highway 47, Black Creek, WI 54106

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC Ret'd - Insufficient Address - Unable to Forward

Case called @ 2:09 p.m. Defendant Mark A. Leavitt in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15TR2062 & 15TR2063 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Bond previously posted to be applied.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Mark A. Leavitt in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not yet obtain a valid DL. Is requesting additional time to complete assessment and obtain a valid DL.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 3:25 PM: Defendant Mark A. Leavitt in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel and wishes to plead guilty.  Court advises Def that upon review of his record he is eligible for reinstatement.  NGP entered by Court as to both matters.   STC Scheduled to allow Def time to reinstatement - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

citations.chargeDescr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
